tit.cmt: Aside from the movies with "Lampoon" in the title, the word is unfamiliar to me, so I changed it to "Satirical Poem"
タイトルですので、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 落首（らくしゅ）は、平安時代から江戸時代にかけて流行した表現主法の一つである。
sen.e: Rakushu (lampoon in 31-syllable verse) is a vehicle of expression which was prevalent from the Heian to the Edo period.
A rakushu (a satirical poem with a 31 syllable verse) is a vehicle of expression which was prevalent from the Heian to the Edo period.
sen.cmt: lampoon→parody; eliminated dash between 31 and syllable
sen.e: A rakushu (a satirical poem with a 31 syllable verse) is a vehicle of expression which was prevalent from the Heian to the Edo period.

sen.j: 公共の場所、特に人の集まりやすい辻や河原などに立て札を立て、主に世相を風刺した狂歌を匿名で公開する。
sen.e: In public places, especially crossroads and riversides where many people gathered, notices were put up to publish anonymously written kyoka (lit. mad poems) that generally caricatured topical events.

In public places, especially intersections and riversides where people easily gathered, notices would be put up, publishing anonymously written kyoka (lit. mad poems) that generally satirized current events.
sen.cmt: "crossroads" does not quite sound like a general meeting place to me, so I changed it to "intersections"; I can almost go with "caricatured" here, but I like "satirized" more; "topical" does not quite sound natural here, so I changed it to "current"
sen.e: In public places, especially intersections and riversides where people easily gathered, notices would be put up, publishing anonymously written kyoka (lit. mad poems) that generally satirized current events.

sen.j: 当然のことながら当時言論の自由というものは存在せず、政治批判は極めて危険性の高い行為だった。
sen.e: Needless to say, there was no freedom of speech in those days, and political criticism was a highly risky act.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Needless to say, there was no freedom of speech in those days, and political criticism was a highly risky act.
That there was no freedom of speech in those days was a matter of course, and political criticism was a highly risky act.
sen.cmt: （NCの訳を元に）翻訳を分けました。

sen.j: だが匿名での公開によって、読み書きができる者なら誰でも自由に言論活動を展開することができた。
sen.e: Any literate person could however freely engage in discursive activities by anonymously publishing his political views.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Any literate person could however freely engage in discursive activities by anonymously publishing his political views.
Any literate person, however, could freely engage in discursive activities by anonymously publishing their political views.
sen.cmt: （NCの訳を元に）翻訳を分けました。

sen.j: 類似した例に「落書」（らくしょ）があり、落首よりやや長めの文が公開された。
sen.e: 'Rakusho' (lampoons) were similar in nature. In rakusho authors published slightly longer passages than those in rakushu.
"Rakusho" (parodies) were similar in nature with slightly longer passages than those in rakushu.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read as one sentence instead of two
sen.e: "Rakusho" (parodies) were similar in nature with slightly longer passages than those in rakushu.

sen.j: 有名な落書として「二条河原の落書」が挙げられる。
sen.e: One of the famous rakusho is 'Nijo Kawara Rakusho' (Lampoon in the riverside of the Nijo river).
A famous rakusho is the "Nijo Kawara Rakusho" (Parody on the riverside of the Nijo River).
A famous rakusho is the 'Nijo Kawara no Rakusho' (Parody on the riverside of the Nijo-gawa River).

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字にしました。

sen.j: 上杉氏に 逢うては織田氏も 手取川
sen.e: The Oda clan faced the Uesugi clan at the Tetori river.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Oda clan faced the Uesugi clan at the Tetori river.
The Oda clan faced the Uesugi clan at the Tetori-gawa River.

sen.j: はねる上杉謙信 逃ぐる織田信長 （手取川の戦い）。
sen.e: Kenshin UESUGI was jumping on one side and Nobunaga ODA was running away on the other (Battle at the Tetori river).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kenshin UESUGI was jumping on one side and Nobunaga ODA was running away on the other (Battle at the Tetori river).
Kenshin UESUGI was jumping on one side and Nobunaga ODA was running away on the other (Battle at the Tetori-gawa River).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が 四国の米を 買いかねて
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI can't really bring himself to purchase rice in Shikoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI can't really bring himself to purchase rice in Shikoku.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI can't really bring himself to purchase rice in Shikoku.

sen.j: 今日も五斗買い 明日も五斗買い （四国征伐）。
sen.e: He bought goto (90 liters of rice) today and will buy another tomorrow (Shikoku Conquest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He bought goto (90 liters of rice) today and will buy another tomorrow (Shikoku Conquest).
He bought goto (90 liters of rice) today and will buy another tomorrow (Shikoku Conquest).

sen.j: 徳川家康は 独り熟して 落ちにけり 木の下に居て 拾う豊臣秀頼 （二条城の落首）
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was alone ripe and fell off the tree, under which Hideyori TOYOTOMI was ready to pick it up (Rakushu at the Nijo Castle).
An Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was alone and ripe, falling off a tree, under which Hideyori TOYOTOMI was ready to pick it up (Rakushu at Nijo Castle).
